result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- No possession of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deandre Ferguson in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
*Decision making program.
*No possession of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court will allow early termination after 8 months upon successful completion of all conditions.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Deandre Ferguson in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests time to investigate this matter further.  She is requesting at least 60 days.   Court ordered case adjourned for a tentative projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-07-2015
$250.00 bail to be returned. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-26-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Deandre Ferguson
Current: 9656 West Bradley Road, #209, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 02-10-2015)
Prior: 9656 West Bradley Road, #209, Milwaukee, WI 53224

Defendant Deandre Ferguson in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.46  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
